subject: Productivity
title: Remote Work and Time Boundaries
description: A micro-lesson that makes Remote Work and Time Boundaries usable.

hook.text: In 2020, millions started working from home. The commute vanished but so did the off switch.

buildup.text: Remote work blurred start and end times. Many worked longer hours without realizing it.

discovery.text: Microsoft data showed remote workers added an extra hour to their average workday during the pandemic.

twist.text: Without physical boundaries, time management shifted from employer's problem to employee's challenge.

climax.text: Setting firm start and stop times became the new survival skill for remote workers.

punchline.text: No commute doesn't mean no boundaries.

quiz.question: What did Microsoft data show about remote work during the pandemic?
options: Workers added an extra hour to their average workday
Workers took more breaks than in the office
